Customer Orders

Creating Customer Orders

Orders are created when the selected items are added to the shopping cart and the checkout process is completed on the Item Search page. The Customer Order feature enables you to process and complete the order of these selected items. For more information, see Customer Service.

To create a customer order, perform the following steps:

  1. On the Item Search page, search and select an item.
  2. After you add the desired items to the shopping cart and complete the checkout process, the Call Center page that provides the details of the order is displayed. 
  3. In the Orders Details panel, the order details such as its number, status, type, store number where the order is placed, and payment status are displayed. You can apply promotions, coupons, appeasements at the order level by clicking the respective links.
  4. Click the Promotions and Coupons links displayed against each item to apply promotions and coupons at the item level.
  5. Click theicon to add instruction and communication notes at order and item level.
  6. Click the icon that is next to the Price field of the item to override the item prices. Also, you can add and override the Value Added Service(VAS) charges at the item level.
  7. Click the Add more items to the order link to add more items to the customer order.
  8. In the Order Total section, click the icon that is next to the Estimated S&H field to override the shipping and handling charges.
  9. Enter the required details in the Shipping and Payment tabs.
  10. In the Payment tab, after the payment details are complete and the value in the Remaining to Pay field is zero, click the Proceed to Summary button to display the Summary tab.
  11. The Summary panel displays the payment details of the order. Click Edit to modify the payment details, if required.
  12. To complete the order, click Place Order.
  13. A confirmation popup will appear to confirm the placement of the order.

  14. Select 'Close' and the user will be navigated to the Customer Transactions UI.

Viewing Order Status

  1. In the left quick access pane of the Customer Engagement page, click Orders. The Order List page is displayed.  
  2. Select the order for which you want to view the order status and click View Order Status (NextGen). The Call Center page is displayed.
  1. In the Orders Status section, the order details such as its number, status, type, store number where the order is placed, and payment status are displayed.
  2. In the Payment Info section, you can view the payment information.
  3. In the Items section, you can view the details of the selected item.
  4. In the Status Summary section, you can view the shipping details of the order.

Order Details

  1. In the left quick access pane of the Customer Engagement page, click Orders. The Order List page is displayed.  
  2. Select the order for which you want to view the order status and click View Order Details. The Order Details page displays the details of the selected order.
  3. Select the check box against the order and you can perform the following actions on the selected order by clicking the respective buttons:
  • Allocate
  • Release
  • Cancel
  • Edit

Modifying Orders

  1. In the left quick access pane of the Customer Engagement page, click Orders. The Order List page is displayed.  
  2. Select the order for which you want to view the order status and click View Order Status (NextGen). The Call Center page is displayed.
  3. In the Payment Info section, click  icon and select Edit. The order opens in the edit mode
  4. In the Orders Details section, you can edit the promotions, coupons, appeasements at the order level (for all the selected items) by clicking the corresponding link.
  5. Click the Order Promotions and Order Coupons links to edit the offers and coupons applied to the order.
  6. You can view the details of each item and edit the promotions and coupons at the item level by clicking the respective Promotions and Coupons links that are displayed for each item.
  7. Click the icon to add instruction and communication notes at order and item level. 
  8. Click the icon that is next to the Price field of the item to override the item prices. Also, you can add and override the Value Added Service(VAS) charges at the item level.
  9. Click the Add more items to the order link to add more items to the customer order.
  10. In the Order Total section, click the icon that is next to the Estimated S&H charges field to override the shipping and handling charges.
  11. Click the Shipping, Payment, and the Summary tabs and modify the editable fields, if required, to complete the order.

Canceling Orders

Customers may request for cancelation of items in a multiple item order or a reduction in the quantity of ordered items. Orders can be canceled if the order status is less than 'Partially Released'.
Each item in an order is considered as an order line. You can cancel an order line only in a multiple item order.

Note: If you cancel an order which has a single order line, the Selected Order line cannot be deleted, order should have at least one line message is displayed.

To cancel an order, perform the following steps:

  1. On the Item Search page, search and select an item.
  2. After you add the desired items to the shopping cart and complete the checkout process, the Call Center page that provides the details of the order is displayed. 
  3. In the Order Details section of the Call Center page, click the   icon, and then select Cancel.
  4. In the Cancel Order window, select a reason and enter comments for canceling the order.
  5. Click Done.

Holding Orders

The Customer Transaction page enables you to place an order on hold.

To place an order on hold, perform the following steps:

  1. On the Item Search page, search and select an item.
  2. After you add the desired items to the shopping cart and complete the checkout process, the Call Center page that provides the details of the order is displayed. 
  3. In the Order Details section of the Call Center page, click the   icon, and then select Hold.
  4. In the Hold Order window, select a reason and enter the comments for placing the order on hold.
  5. Click Done.
